meanings.definition: Not following a formal or strict structure or set of rules.
meanings.sent1: The nonformal gathering in the park had no set agenda.
meanings.sent2: She preferred a nonformal approach to teaching, allowing for creativity.
meanings.sent3: The nonformal dress code for the party was 'wear whatever makes you happy.'
meanings.sent4: His nonformal leadership style encouraged innovation and flexibility.
meanings.sent5: The nonformal atmosphere of the event made everyone feel at ease.

meanings.sent1: The nonformal meeting with friends was full of laughter and jokes.
meanings.sent2: They enjoyed the nonformal setting of the picnic by the lake.
meanings.sent3: The nonformal handshake turned into a friendly hug.
meanings.sent4: Her nonformal attitude towards deadlines sometimes caused confusion.
meanings.sent5: The nonformal tone of the conversation put everyone in a good mood.
